item.description:
Let's continue our holiday weekend celebration with a Spanish dinner:

"Among the multitude of recipes that make up the varied cuisines of Spain, a few can be considered common to all or almost all of Spain's regions, even though some of them have an origin known and associated with specific places. Examples include most importantly potato omelette ("tortilla de patata", "tortilla española" or just "tortilla"), paella, various stews, migas, sausages (such as embutidos, chorizo, and morcilla), jamón serrano, and cheeses. There are also many dishes based on beans (chickpeas, lentils, green beans); soups, with many regional variations; and bread, that has numerous forms, with distinct varieties in each region. The regional variations are less pronounced in Spanish desserts and cakes: flan, custard, rice pudding (arroz con leche), torrijas, churros, and madeleines are some of the most representative examples. Below are some web site with recipes of Spanish food."

http://www.epicureantable.com/spanish.htm

http://www.donquijote.org/culture/spain/food/

http://www.spain-recipes.com/

everyone will bring a different Spanish dish or a drink to share.  Please post what you will be bringing with your RSVP so I can make sure we have a balanced meal. I will send out the address closer to the date of the event.
item.how_to_find_us: I will send out the address closer to the date

group.name: The Boston Euro Social Meetup Group

item.name: Spanish Dinner Party
